Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open a new eclipse instance
2. Make sure the perspective is NOT on Remote System Explorer. If it is, change to any other perspective, close eclipse and reopen.
3. Either create a new C/C++ Remote Application launch config or select an existing one. You'll get an NPE and the config page will not open.


More information:
This bug is closely related to bug 190613 and bug 194020. But they seem to be associated with having not having any connections defined whereas I have 3 connections defined. The stack trace is the same:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.remotecdt.RemoteCMainTab.updateConnectionPulldown(RemoteCMainTab.java:329)
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.remotecdt.RemoteCMainTab.createRemoteConnectionGroup(RemoteCMainTab.java:162)
at org.eclipse.rse.internal.remotecdt.RemoteCMainTab.createControl(RemoteCMainTab.java:82)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationTabGroupViewer.showInstanceTabsFor(LaunchConfigurationTabGroupViewer.java:833)
...

After stepping through the code, the NPE is a result of RSE not being initialized. In particular, RSECorePlugin.getTheSystemRegistry() returns null on RemoteCMainTab.java line 329.

A quick and dirty way to get around this problem is to switch to the RSE perspective and then try to open the Remote CDT launch config. It'll work fine after that.

In fact, this may be the root of the problems in the two bugs mentioned above as well, since they are get NPEs on the same line of code. If that's the case, sorry for the dupe.
Changed the product from "DSDP" to "Target Management". Seems that's where the bug belonged in the first place.
